content: on either side and which you can turn to have the colours you like at the front here s a link to a good video http //www knittinghelp com/video/play/kitchener-stitch if you really can t face it just use regular cast on and bind off and then join as neatly as you can or use provisional cast on and then 3- needle bind off you ll get a seam on the ws but it will be invisible on the rs bias knitting technique - on the right side you will increase one stitch at the beginning of each row and decrease one stitch at the end of the row on the wrong side there are no increases or decreases it is important to check on your stitch counts regularly to make sure you are not adding or losing stitches © susan ashcroft 2011 - for personal non-commercial use only page 2 split stitch marker for the lacy version the stitch marker will be helpful to identify the right side for all versions you can also use it as a life-line - i count the stitches about every 12 row and move the marker up to the row i have just counted that way if i forget an increase or decrease i know how far back i need to unpick checking approx every 12 row will mean you won t get too far before realizing you ve made a mistake joining the yarn to keep a smooth edge join the yarn two or three stitches in from the edge and weave in the ends - or splice blocking probably not necessary but if you prefer to block use your favourite method abbreviations k knit kfb knit into the front and back of the stitch k2tog knit 2 together p purl yo yarn over needle sl slip_stitch knitwise psso pass slipped stitch over rs - right side ws - wrong side note - rs/ws is only for the purposes of knitting - once grafted you can wear either side © susan ashcroft 2011 - for personal non-commercial use only page 3 stockinette with ridges version you can work as many knit row as you like before working the ridges - for the long striping version tooty frooty i thought the 4-row repeat worked well breaking up the colour runs for the handpainted version i used a 6-row repeat to give longer stockinette sections to showcase the shading edge stitches - the pattern has been written without edge stitches for a neater slightly tighter edge you may wish to slip the first stitch on every row cast on using provisional cast on the required number of stitches then work as follows i suggesting checking your stitch number after row 1 to make sure you have the same number of stitches as you cast on 4 -row repeat row 1 k1 kfb k to last 3 stitches k2tog k1 row 2 p1 knit to last stitch p1 row 3 repeat row 1 row 4 purl
